fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
For the event types where *Who* is not required, the name of the user does not get imported to the Subscribed Calendar(in this case Google Calendar)

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice to have the same result as for 'Travel' event. The name present in the "who" field of custom event type should get populated to the subscribed calendar.

h3. Why this is important
Users are not able to see the name of the person in Google Calendar for the custom event type, the name is important to be displayed as in other default event types to let users know who has created that event.

h3. Workaround 
NA
fields.summary: The name of the users in the "who" should be exported even when not required for the event type

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* Instance that has the new Meeting Note template enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a space
# Create two Meeting Notes with the new Meeting Note blueprint and add several tasks to each of them
# Create a blank page
# Add a Task Report macro which filters tasks from that space and have a "meeting-notes" label. All the tasks created in step 2 is shown
# Click the checkbox to in the macro complete one of the tasks
# Reload the page that contains the macro

h3. Expected Results
The task that was selected in step 5 is completed

h3. Actual Results
An other task in the different page is completed and the selected one remains open
 
h3. Notes
* This happens in the [Meeting Note index|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/meeting-notes-template-937893665.html#Meetingnotestemplate-Meetingnotesindex] page, too
fields.summary: Task status sync is broken for the tasks from the new Meeting Note in Task Report macro/Meeting Note index page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When copying a table with the following methods:
# Hover and click on first header cell up to last cell and pasting it on either a macro or on a page, notice that the table loses its format
# Hover and click on the first header cell + shift direct keyboard arrow to last cell, notice that the table loses its format

See video for reference

h3. Notes

This does not happen on Confluence server (e.g. 6.11)
fields.summary: Copying tables from first header cell to last cell results in a single line when pasted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the template for meeting notes is edited (without modifying anything), the meeting notes page created will be different from the template.

h3. Environment
* Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the *Edit* button next to the Meeting Notes template on Global Templates page;
# Save it without changing anything;
# Create a new meeting notes page;

h3. Expected Results
The page should be correctly constructed, as the template is.

h3. Actual Results
Some formatting issues are noticeable:
|  !metting_notes_template.png|width=500!  |
 

h3.Workaround
Re-create the template or set it to the default one.
fields.summary: Meeting notes created with the edited template has formatting issues

fields.description:
Freeze Frontend production deployment due to FY19 Q1 Earnings Call

https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SRE/pages/233616550/RFC+-+FY19+H1+Change+Freeze+Advisory
fields.summary: FY19 Q1 Earnings Call Freeze

fields.description:
On hello.atlassian.com/wiki (Confluence Cloud) my personal space is failing to load my page tree. See attachment.
 * Affected URL: [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~mghiraldelli/overview]
 * Expect: When clicking on the Page Tree link on the left tool bar, my existing pages tree
 * What I see: An error message.

I couldn't find an appropriate component to open this bug.
fields.summary: Page tree not showing up on my personal space

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Editor throwing 500 Errors / Null Pointer Exceptions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Publish a page with previous Unpublished Changes

h3. Expected Results
The page will be published.

h3. Actual Results
* The page isn't published.
* A message saying "Unable to communicate with server. Saving is not possible at the moment." is displayed and the *Publish* button gets greyed out.
* A 500 error is displayed in the browser's console
fields.summary: Editor throwing 500 Errors / Null Pointer Exceptions

fields.description: Allow Confluence System Administrators to force an specific user to logout (expire the session) through the Administration console. In example, if the Administrator access the panel, he can choose an user session to be finished, so the user would be automatically logged out in case of not having physical access to the machine (tclean the browser cookies forcing the logout).
fields.summary: Force Specific User Session to Expire

fields.description:
In Confluence, when using the [Content Report Table macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/content-report-table-macro-724765181.html], the same includes the page name, author and also, the modified date for a page. 

As the macro has the intent to work with reports, it would be really helpful if the same had the ability to include a new *attachments* field, so attachments labeled would also be displayed, providing help for additional reports.
fields.summary: "Attachments" field for Content Report macro

fields.description:
Summary:
Clicking on person name link in an embedded blog post macro returns "404 Not Found" error.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Blog post
# Include a Blog post macro on a page
# Click on user who created the page. Screenshot:
 !2018-10-17_11-55-05.png|thumbnail! 

Expected results:
Go to that users profile page

Actual Results:
"404 Not Found" error

Link points to https://confluence-prod-ap-1-3-prod.atl-paas.net/people/ID however it should point to https://<cloud_url>.atlassian.net/people/ID

Workaround:
None at this time
fields.summary: Clicking on person name link in blog post macro returns 404 error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the new editor (meeting notes, blog post, templates), it's not possible to drag and drop a file to a bulleted or numbered list.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new meeting notes
# Create a numbered or bulleted list
# try to drag and drop a file between two items of the list

h3. Expected Results
The file should be uploaded and shown on the page

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens:
 !attach_file_bullet_list.gif|width=700! 

 
h3.Workaround
Drop the file outside the list.
fields.summary: Can't attach files on a bulleted/ numbered list list with the new editor

fields.description:
When performing a space export, we expect to only export the contents of a single space.

In certain situations where the database is corrupted in subtle ways, we will sometimes get multiple spaces exported.

The symptom is that the {{entities.xml}} file contained in the export will contain more than one space. Searching for {{object class="Space"}} will return more than one result.

 
h3. Workaround

Follow the steps at [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/importing-a-space-fails-with-could-not-execute-statement-error-in-confluence-server-949242294.html]

Also, rebuild the CONFANCESTORS table.
fields.summary: Space export may export multiple spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using the new editor (blog/ meeting notes/ templates), it's not possible to access attached files using the "Files & Images" button.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* New editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new meeting notes page (using the new editor);
# Click on the "Files & Images" button.

h3. Expected Results
It should open the "insert files and images" pop-up:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-16 at 18.40.45.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
It directly opens the Computer's file selector:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-16 at 18.48.07.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Drag and drop the file.
fields.summary: Can't access attached files on the new editor

fields.description: Currently, if user is using a macro for instance (easyBI) on a Confluence and tried to export the page in pdf format. The pdf of that page will not render the dashboard due to the reason mentioned in this [community post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/CONFLUENCE-X-EAZYBI-EXPORT-PDF/qaq-p/896810] . It would be useful if this is support so that the dashboard could be exported directly from Confluence.
fields.summary: Ability to render dynamic content from Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a {{dynamicMacro}} with {{bodyType=rich-text}} and content Confluence tables, the resulting page does not bind the sorting capability of tables inside the dynamicMacros

*Steps to replicate*
1. Install Macro Toolbox for Confluence Cloud
2. Create a new "Heading expand/collapse" macro
3. Insert a table that would normally be sortable inside the macro.
4. Publish the page, notice that the table isn't sortable.
5. Edit the page and remove the Macro and place the table out in the open of the page.
6. Publish the page, notice that the table works as it should.

h3. Investigation

This issue is consistent on a number of apps such as: Macro Toolbox, Navitabs, Service Rocket, RefinedWiki
fields.summary: Tables sorting behavior not binded for dynamicMacros

fields.description:
As per the current users' feedback, one of our customers has listed some accessibility issues we've found with Confluence.


!Tried with JAWS 2018 and NVDA

h3. In general:

     *   Lack of structure around the whole app (no landmarks for navigation areas, main page…)
     *   Hard to get a sense of what's there in the list of pages: no indication of current page, it doesn't announce what's expandable/collapsible, or nesting levels
     *   Lots of labels missing
     *   Rich text editors are clunky and have too many tab stops
     *   Problem across the site: almost everything is incorrectly announced as "Clickable" (probably due to an event handler on a parent container), with JAWS
     *   Registration can be a blocker for screen reader users due to the captcha

h3. On the initial registration page from the invite email

     *   we got stuck on the reCaptcha -- it keeps saying "Checkbox not checked" on the "I'm not a robot" checkbox, even when the check window appears. Initially unable to create an account. There is normally an audio verification challenge, but we were plain unable to even get there or identify that a challenge was present. After more tries it appears that this dialog displays after the end of the page (instead of being next to the "I'm not a robot" area). It took us 3 tries to reach the audio challenge, then once completed it refused it, and after reloading the page we were able to click the checkbox
     *   Essentially, there are issues with reCaptcha in general, which should be made more accessible by Google, but the positioning of the window was odd and may be due to odd scripting.
     *   Also the security progress bar for the password is not very clear, it doesn't announce its purpose and its status is not announced as it changes. When you arrow down after the password field it just announces "Good" without any further context

h3.  Initial setup after registration

     *   The steps line doesn't say what's the current step
     *   p1 "Upload an image" button doesn't announce it's a button
     *   P3 "Go mobile" page: no label on the app store/google play icons

h3.  Dashboard - menu

     *   The "my profile" menu (icon) is announced as gibberish, like "88c59e4c655e25bb556f1…". It announces the src of the profile image, as it has no alt text or label.
     *   Pop-up for creating a new page seems broken, the focus is lost in the background and nothing is announced. Navigating with the arrow keys works and moves the focus visually, but nothing is announced.
     *   Spaces switcher not working correctly -- announced as Chevron, it is not announced as expanded or collapsed, and the current page is not clearly announced

h3.     Navigation (list of pages in the left panel)

     *   They are all announced as current, not possible to know which one is the currently selected one. In the menu buttons are not announced as collapsed or expanded, and their nesting level is not announced
     *   When opening a page from the navigation, the page loads but user is not informed that the page has loaded -- it should move focus, or notify user that the page is ready to be navigated

h3.   Reading pages

     *   Reading pages is working fine, the hierarchy, tables, images that have alt text… all work fine.
     *   However, confusing that everything is announced as "clickable", it is not easily possible to tell the difference between a link and static text
     *   Adding comment/ rich text editor was confusing, there are too many buttons to tab through. Recommend looking at ARIA toolbar pattern to reduce this to one tab stop, for both keyboard & SR users
     *   Search feature working fine, could be grouped better (unclear if the space and date belong to the link above or below)

h3.   Edit a page

     *   Not working well, hard to tell the difference between editable area and toolbar
     *   Toolbar buttons not labelled correctly
     *   The style switcher is not announced as a listbox, it says for example "Heading 2, Link"


Thanks!
fields.summary: Enhance Confluence accessiblity

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Importing DOC files that were created from other Microsoft Apps like [One Note|https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/830047/how-to-import-and-export-information-in-onenote], causes the import to fail.

Even though it fails, a blank page is created and cannot be deleted from the Confluence UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a document to DOC from another Microsoft application;
 # Import the DOC file into Confluence.

h3. Expected Results
 * The file is imported and a new page is added to Confluence with the content from the DOC file.

h3. Actual Results
 * Import fails and a blank and undeletable page is created.

h3. Workaround
 * No workaround at the moment.


Please also check the related issue and fix as part of looking into this issue.
fields.summary: Word Imports fails if the DOC file is generated from another MS App

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the restriction dialog for a page, the text will collide with the drop-down's arrow:

!restriction.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Confluence page, make sure to either tap the *ellipsis button > Restrictions* or click on the padlock on the top of the page
# Once the restrictions dialog is open, make sure to tap the drop-down for the restriction type and select the *Viewing and Editing Restricted* option

h3. Expected Results
The text will be clear, without overwriting the arrow for the drop-down

h3. Actual Results
The arrow and the text are colliding. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment since it's a design issue.
fields.summary: Text view issue in restrictions type dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unknown Users after Migrating from a Confluence server instance
h3. Description

After migrating space by space from another Confluence instance, there might be users listed as *Former Users*
h3. Cause

The root cause of this issue is that the usernames associated with the users on the Server instance do not match the usernames of the same user in Cloud, and so the import system has no way to match the two users up.

The problem can be exacerbated if the users have had their cloud usernames changed in between importing spaces.
h3. Fix

The long term fix is to user additional fields (such as email address) to match up users. This will take some time to implement.

 

Note

This bug was discovered as part of this other bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-59989
fields.summary: Former users after importing from Server instance

fields.description:
When using the *[Activity Stream Macro/Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/activity-stream-macro-724765158.html]* and looking to *add* a filter for the Confluence part, one of them will be called the *Author* and it will only provide the *Followed by Me* option in the drop-down:

!recent.png|thumbnail!

This is a suggestion to allow the drop-down to bring additional options like groups and individual users, so the macro could focus on specific parameters for a specific user/group.
fields.summary: Additional Options for Confluence's Activity Stream Filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, questions are not being returned in the search results.

h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a question.
 # Search for this question(with terms contained in the question) using the sidebar search functionality.

h3. Expected Results
The Question should get displayed under add-on section.

h3. Actual Results
No add-on section comes and hence no question as a result of the search.
This used to work before.

h3. Workaround
NA
fields.summary: Questions doesn't display as a search result of the global sidebar search functionality of Confluence

fields.description:
When accessing pages in Confluence the URL structure is the following:
<INSTANCENAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACEKEY>/pages/<PAGEID>/<PAGETITLE>

Removing the pages/<PAGEID> from the page URL causes the page to return a _Page Not Found_ message in most of the cases, but for some pages it redirects to the correct page address.

It would be great if the redirect was the default behavior when to this scenario where the page address had the pages/<PAGEID> removed from the URL.
fields.summary: Redirect to pages when only the title is given in the URL

fields.description:
In Confluence, the user has the ability to insert issues from Jira by using the [Jira issues macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html] so the same will be displayed directly in the page content. 

In situations where the issue has been deleted, Confluence will only show the following message where the issue should be displayed in the editor:

"Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error."

This is a suggestion to improve the message for a delete issue, to clarify that this is not an unexpected error, but, that the same has been deleted on Jira.
fields.summary: Improve message for already deleted Jira Issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Export to PDF does not render Emojis and Icons in information panels and Text in information panels has different sizes
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page or a blog
 # Add several emojis on the page
 # Export the page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
 * Emojis should be rendered in the exported PDF file.
 * Text in information panels should have the same size.

h3. Actual Results
 * Emojis are not intermittently not rendered in the exported PDF file.
|!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!|

h3. Notes
 * Also reproduced with *Word* files.
fields.summary: Export to PDF/Word does not render Emojis

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Excel macro in Cloud no longer has the "Show Grid" option and therefore it's not possible to show gridlines within the macro.

I've also attempted doing so using the markup available on the [Server version of the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-excel-macro-375849173.html], but it's not possible. 

In addition, the Excel macro is being rewritten, but on the new editor it still doesn't seem like there's a way to include gridlines.

Referring to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/office-excel-macro-724765234.html] and in tests on a known instance with the new editor.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability to show gridlines in an Excel document embedded on a Confluence page.
fields.summary: Ability to Show Grid in Excel Macro

fields.description: It would be useful if user is allow to configure the default behavior when selecting attachment on the *Labelled content* page or disabled download option when searching for an attachment from the quick search
fields.summary: Preview attachment instead of download by default

fields.description:
When macros like code block macro are added inside a table cell, when expanded the page expands beyond the user's screen, and the page becomes unreadable, being necessary to navigate to the bottom of the page to utilize scrollbars. 

Having both tables and macros working responsively would be a great addition to the application.
fields.summary: Responsive macros when inside table cells

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* User is getting a push notification in IOS when someone edits a page that the user is watching even though they unchecked the 'Notify watchers' option when they published their changes. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User 1 creates a page 
# User 2 edit the page that User 1 created. User 2 will uncheck the 'Notify watchers' option when publishing the changes. 

h3. Expected Results
* User 1 should not get a push notification in IOS Mobile app if 'Notify watchers' option was unchecked.

h3. Actual Results
* User 1 is getting a push notification in IOS mobile app.
fields.summary: Getting notified on watched pages in Mobile app notification even 'Notify watchers' was unchecked

fields.description: In order to be able to export a single chart, it is necessary to export the whole page to Word of PDF. It would be great for users if they could export/download charts individually.
fields.summary: Ability to Export/Download Charts individually

fields.description:
When a Jira only user accessing Confluence. The error message message will pop out on the screen such as below:

!image-2018-10-12-19-11-42-478.png|width=148,height=149!

This make the error very unclear and most of the time the user do not aware what are the cause for this. It would be better a if message such as "Your email address <email>@gmail.com doesn't have access to xxx.atlassian.com/wiki "
fields.summary: Unclear error message from Confluence when Jira only user accessing Confluence

fields.description:
We have some people in our organisation who have access to Confluence and have been using it on a daily basis but when they try to update the calendar and look for their name under Who then it does not show up.

It started with couple of users but now we have quite a few of them who are experiencing it thereby reducing the benefit of using the calendar option.
fields.summary: User name is not available when updating Confluence calendar even though user exist

fields.description:
Being able to automatically report on last login date for all users key when reporting on Jira's/Confluence's success and user engagement within our organisation.

Neither /user nor /user/search return info on the last login date needed to find dormant users.

 

And even using user/search you cannot search for "Last Jira login date" and "Last Confluence login date" but getting last login date for all users is much more helpful for reporting on Jira's/Confluence's success within our organisation.
fields.summary: Add "Last Jira login date" and "Last Confluence login date" to REST API user calls

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Confluence in a different language than English, pages created from specific [templates/blueprints|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/blueprints-and-user-created-templates-724764985.html] will not have the text translated. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prior to accessing Confluence, make sure to change your browser language to a different language (in this example, French).
# Edit [your user settings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/edit-your-user-settings-724765386.html] to change the language to the specific language (or automatically detect from the browser)
# In Confluence, as an administrator, make sure to change the language through the *General Configuration* option, in the *Settings* button from the sidebar.
# Now, create a new blueprint using templates like *Meeting Notes*, *Marketing Plan*, *Decision*

h3. Expected Results
All the used templates should display the text respecting the configured language.

h3. Actual Results
In some templates, the text continues in English and will not be translated, as the example below, for the *Meeting Notes* one:
!notes.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Manually change the template to the configured language through the *Global Blueprints and Templates* section in the *Settings* of Confluence.
fields.summary: Some blueprints do not respect configured language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unlicensed Users are receiving error messages when trying to view Confluence spaces

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Confluence + Jira Service Desk instance, set a space with *Any active user can view this space* enabled
# With a user that only has Application Access to Jira Service Desk - without explicit Confluence access - navigate to the space you just set with Unlicensed Access

h3. Expected Results
Everything works as expected

h3. Actual Results
The sidebar won't load. Instead an error message with *Something's gone wrong. Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.* and error details describing {{Error: Cannot read property 'locale' of null.}} are displayed in the page and/or at the sidebar.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unlicensed Users are receiving error messages when trying to view Confluence spaces

fields.description:
Looks like fixed headers for scrollable tables has been raised (and "resolved") before, but practically speaking it's never really been properly fixed.

There is CONFCLOUD-9267, that claims that things have been fixed long time ago, but practically that is not the case, as we can see [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Do-you-know-how-to-freeze-the-headers-when-we-scroll-through-a/qaq-p/125261] and [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Sticky-header-row/qaq-p/123922].

In practice, I should not care whether a table has:
 * been embedded into page layouts/sections
 * row numbers
 * merged cells
 * a horizontal scroll

The header should "just work"™.
fields.summary: Unconditional Fixed Headers on Tables

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Confluence Cloud in IE
# Open Network tab in Developer Tools
# Access a space
# (option: Create a page)

h3. Expected Results
There are no errors in the Network tab

h3. Actual Results
Several connections with cloudfront are returning 403/404 errors.
This is affecting the overall performance:
* it takes a minute to open the "Create" modal after clicking the + icon, or it sometimes doesn't load at all
* all operations are affected.
fields.summary: Internet Explorer 11 performance degration caused by unstable cloudfront connection

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the search REST API: https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest/#content-search.

Reference documentation: https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-server-rest-api/advanced-searching-using-cql/performing-text-searches-using-cql

Specifically:

Note: All query terms in Confluence are case insensitive.

The following CQL produce different results. The first finds content and the second does not.

They should find the same content when the existing page is commentPage:

{code}
type=page and space=ztp and title=commentPage
type=page and space=ztp and title=COMMENTPage
{code}

This is on bobswift13.atlassian.net, but I don't think that the instance matters.
We have found other examples where it is case-insensitive. Similarly, it appears to be case insensitive on space name but now, given the above results, we are no longer confident in that either.

h3. Background

Originally from linked CE project but I cannot move it here, so created a new one. The server counter part https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-54813 is already fixed as well
fields.summary: Case sensitivity in CQL using REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

1. List of spaces is not shown when you are checking them in Space Directory.
At the same time you can access any space having direct link.

2. You might also experience that "Recently worked on" is not shown properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Access your Space Directory:
https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/wiki/spacedirectory/view.action

h3. Expected Results

You should see all Spaces.

h3. Actual Results

No spaces shown.

h3.Workaround

There is an issue with indexing and you will need to contact [Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] to help you fix this issue. Please refer to this bug when creating a ticket.
fields.summary: Spaces are not shown in Space Directory

fields.description: 2018-10-10 10:57:20,885 DEBUG [165:StdOutHandler [/usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle/jre/bin/java]] \{"synchrony":{"message":"synchrony.sync.hub [warn] closing out-channel due to overflow","ns":"synchrony.sync.hub","level":"warn"}}
fields.summary: Gets Synchrony error message and Confluence hangs until restart

fields.description:
1. Import a space
2. Run JIRA Macro Repair
3. Get a dialog that says "undefined"
4. Dismiss dialog and run again - same result
fields.summary: JIRA Macro Repair doesn't work on space import

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Not possible to change the entire column color.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table on Confluence or Jira.
# Select a column to change the color of the text.

h3. Expected Results

It changes the color of all text of the selected column.

h3. Actual Results

It changes only the color of the first cell.
fields.summary: Not possible to change the entire column color

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Keystroke Slowness on Large Pages

h3. Environment
Tested in Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox on macOS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a brand new Confluence Page, create a table with ~200 rows
# Inside this table, paste chunks of text enough to make it have more than 100.000 characters
# Keep writing in the page

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to keep editing the page as usual

h3. Actual Results
There is a delay between keystrokes and the character actually being displayed in the screen
fields.summary: Keystroke Slowness on Large Pages

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add a table in a confluence page
# Change the color of the table heading to any other color besides black

h3. Expected Results
Text stays bold and retains the new color.

h3. Actual Results
Text changes color but does not stay bold. 

h3. Workaround
Change the color back to black.
fields.summary: Bold table headings go away if text color is changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Exports are not working for Confluence Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Perform any kind of export of content in Confluence (Backup, Space export, page export)

h3. Expected Results
Export completes and an export file is generated.

h3. Actual Results
Exports fail with the following error message:
{code}
Unexpected error during export has occurred
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
{code}

h3.Workaround
No Workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Confluence Exports Are Failing Consistently

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When in preview mode, it is not possible to publish the page using *⌘+Enter* shortcut. The page does nothing. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page
# Set to preview mode
# Use ⌘+Enter shortcut to publish the page

h3. Current behavior
The page does nothing when using the shortcut. 

h3. Expected behavior 
The page should be published. 

h3. Workaround
Click on *Publish* button.
fields.summary: It is not possible to publish a page using ⌘Enter shortcut in preview mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Site import is failing if the maintenance banner was not deleted from Server before generating the backup. This error is generated due to a banner which is not available in Confluence Cloud, therefore the import cannot process this attribute.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Import a server backup with Site import feature

h3. Expected Results
Import should be successfully processed

h3. Actual Results
Import is failing with a general error:

bq. Exception occurred during import: Error importing site

h3. Notes
Checking the server logs we can see more details about this issue:
  	{code} stack:	 com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.|FILTERED|.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: maintenanceBannerMessageOn : maintenanceBannerMessageOn
---- Debugging information ----
path                : /settings/maintenanceBannerMessageOn 
message             : maintenanceBannerMessageOn : maintenanceBannerMessageOn 
required-type       : com.atlassian.|FILTERED|.setup.settings.Settings 
line number         : 91 
cause-message       : maintenanceBannerMessageOn : maintenanceBannerMessageOn 
class               : com.atlassian.|FILTERED|.setup.settings.Settings 
cause-exception     : com.thoughtworks.xstream.alias.CannotResolveClassException {code}

h3. Workaround

In order to workaround this issue, we can either remove this banner from the initial Confluence server site or:

# the user can unzip the backup archive and open entities.xml file and remove the following line from the file:
 {code}
   <maintenanceBannerMessageOn>false</maintenanceBannerMessageOn>
 {code}
# Save the file
# Rezip it 
# Submit a new import
fields.summary: Confluence Site import fails due to banner maintenanceBannerMessageOn

fields.description:
In the new version of Confluence Editor, the user cannot add an Expand macro inside the table and this will be added outside of the table.

Attached screenshot from the old editor and from the new editor.
fields.summary: Cannot add Expand macro inside a table in new Confluence Editor

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use IE11 and access a page
# Enter some comment and press "Save"

h3. Expected Results
The comment is saved with no errors

h3. Actual Results
The following error is shown. Note that the comment saving itself is working properly.
{code}
Error: Object doesn't support property or method 'remove' .
	in t
	in o
	in WRMComponent (o)
	...
{code}

 !スクリーンショット 2018-10-09 18.13.51.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Refresh your window or use a different browser
fields.summary: Error when adding comments in IE11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Space import fails due to the username of a user is different in the instances.

h3. Environment
* Cloud to Cloud space import.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence A, create a user with username like testuser
# Restrict a page with the user in Step 1
# Export the space
# Use the same email address to signup for Confluence B (so that the user will get created with username 'admin')
# Import the backup into Confluence B

h3. Expected Results
The import is done without any issue

h3. Actual Results
It shows error in importing the space.

*Application logs:*
{code}
ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "cp_unique_user"
  Detail: Key (cps_id, cp_type, username)=(431424995, View, <hash>) already exists.
{code}

h3.Workaround
Contact [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] in fixing the incosistency in the username
fields.summary: Import Fails if The User Has Different Usernames in Source and Destination Instance (Short term fix)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we update the titled of a child page, the title is not updated on the sidebar

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In [new Confluence Editor experience|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/Improvements-to-the-Confluence-Cloud-editor/ba-p/691463]
# Create a child page > Publish
# Edit the child page again and update the title
# Publish

h3. Expected Results
The title of the page is updated on the sidebar

h3. Actual Results
The title remains with the old title
!screenshot.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* This only happens on the new Confluence Editor experience
* It's working fine if the page is created before switching to new Confluence Editor experience
* Old editor view is working fine
* Noticed this is caused by the sidebar is not reloaded after we publish the child page. (The sidebar is reloaded when we publish the parent page)

h3.Workaround
* Refresh the page to reload the sidebar
fields.summary: Title of a Child Page is Not Updated on Sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The document doesn't mention that customers cannot change *Indexing Language* by themselves and need to contact support.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/configuring-indexing-language-724765534.html

h3. Suggested Solution

Clarify site admin needs to contact our support.
fields.summary: Clarify admin needs to contact support to change indexing language

fields.description: Redirects to https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/byDraft/pages/edit/316792149
fields.summary: Publishing on fabric editor redirects to unsupported URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence Questions notifications aren't being delivered
h3. Description

Currently, if you add yourself as a watcher of all questions and/or specific spaces in Confluence Questions you will not receive notifications about it in your e-mail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Confluence Cloud instance with Confluence Questions installed, add yourself as a watcher of all questions
 # Ask a different user to post a question

h3. Expected Results

You receive an e-mail notification regarding the question that was posted.
h3. Actual Results

You receive no e-mail notifications.

h3. Notes
Currently, no notifications are sent at all, including new answers.
fields.summary: Confluence Questions notifications aren't being delivered

fields.description:
Dates are saved in format of browser locale, this is not configurable.

We use the table filter plugin to filter items in a page properties report on a date. The table filter plugin allows us to specify a date format. But because the page properties plugin doesn't allow to specify this, the filtering will only work if the browser locale has the same date format as the one chosen in the table filter plugin.

Currently this is the English date format and it works for 95% of our users. Some users have Dutch as their browser language and then filtering on date doesn't work.

Why is the date format used in a page properties report not configurable so that every user has the same format? This easy solution would fix thr whole issue
fields.summary: Dates are saved in format of browser locale, this is not configurable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While creating a link, the page doesn't show recently reviewed pages.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# First visit all the pages in any spaces
# Edit any single page, click on "+" and select Link
# Select recently viewed pages in the dialog boxes which will not show you all the pages visited earlier

h3. Expected Results
The visited pages need to be listed under the option *Recently viewed Pages*

h3. Actual Results
Apparently, it doesn't 

h3. Notes
Attaching the screenshot for reference.
fields.summary: Insert Link macro doesn't show recently viewed pages

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Currently, the new editor is not able to properly render charts. Also, if you render the charts from another page, that is still using the previous editor, the content is displayed as "Unsupported Content".

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Create a new page (or blog post) with the new editor
# Insert a char with some data, inside an excerpt macro
# In another page/blog-post, use Excerpt Include to display the content

h3. Expected Results
According to the macro's preview, the chart should be properly rendered.

h3. Actual Results
The page displays "[confluenceUnsupportedBlock]".
fields.summary: Excerpt Include not rendering Charts in Blog Posts

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After inserting images into the new editor, it is not possible to relocate them into the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the new editor, insert an image;
# Try to move the image around the page.

h3. Expected Results
It is possible to move the image.

h3. Actual Results
The image won't move.

h3.Workaround
Cut and paste the image in the location you want it to be placed.
fields.summary: Images can't be moved in the new editor

fields.description:
Is it possible to add a comment field in Confluence that works like the comment function in Jira?
It should be built into a template so that you can add a comment at the end of each column without having to set the page to "edit".
fields.summary: Comment function like Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Broken Image" error is displayed for images from another page (user has access to the page) on both mobile apps. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Mobile app (android AND IOS)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert images on a page ;
# Create another page and attach the images from the first page (from the Insert files and Images dialog);
# Publish the page;
# Open it on the mobile app.

h3. Expected Results
The images would display for the user who created the pages.

h3. Actual Results
An error is shown instead of the image:
 !broken_image.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Re-upload the images on the second page.
fields.summary: Broken image shown for images on the mobile apps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As of now, the Confluence mobile client does not offer the feature to edit DRAFT pages that was created from the desktop web browser.
* Close the page after creating a DRAFT
!Screen Shot 2018-10-08 at 15.59.25.png|thumbnail! 
* Ensure that the DRAFT page appears on the web browser
!Screen Shot 2018-10-08 at 15.59.39.png|thumbnail! 
* Check through the iOS client to confirm that the DRAFT is not there
!Screen Shot 2018-10-08 at 15.59.41.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the same functionality of editing DRAFT pages in the IOS client

h3. Why this is important
In case a user was unable to complete the page at that moment and would like to continue working on the page again while being on the move, it will be good to have this feature implemented
fields.summary: Confluence Mobile: Ability to Edit DRAFT on iOS Client
Using content property index of type String results in 400 Bad Request with "message": "Unrecognised clause"

fields.description:
h3. The Suggestion
Currently, there is no documentation regarding the headers and footers for Confluence Cloud, which is a functionality that is available in all Cloud spaces.
fields.summary: Document space's headers and footers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, when the user does not have the *edit* page restriction, the "edit" button will not be displayed. However, if the user taps the 'padlock' and *apply* the edit restriction, the 'edit' button  will only be displayed if the same refreshes the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, create a page and restrict the edit for your user
# Have another user accessing this page (note that the same must have *Add restriction* permission on the space) and tapping the "restrictions" icon
# Have the same tapping the *Apply* button only for the *edit* restriction

h3. Expected Results
The 'edit' button should be displayed once the restriction is applied.
h3. Actual Results
The 'edit' button is not displayed. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround found at the moment.
fields.summary: Edit restrictions are only applied after refreshing the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, when creating a space with a key/title that already exists, the same will display the following message:

*A space with this space key already exists.*

However, in situations where a space containing the already existing key is restricted, Confluence will not have a message about its existence. The create button will only remain "greyed out".

In situations like this one, it would be helpful if Confluence could provide a message about some impossibility to create the space, but, not necessarily exposing the existing space key.
fields.summary: Improve space dialog creation when restricted space key already exists

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a link from a Jira ticket is pasted in the Confluence editor, the same is converted into a [Jira macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/jira-issues-macro-724765217.html] reflecting the correspondent ticket.

With the [introduction of the new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], the tasks are now *action items*, which will provide an enhanced experience for customers working with actions. When trying to paste a Jira link into the action items, the same is not converted to the macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page already using the new editor (e.g. Meeting Notes or Blog Posts)
# Add a new action item/decision
# In your Jira application, make sure to copy the URL for a Jira ticket (for example, https://test.atlassian.net/browse/Issue-1) in the action item/decision

h3. Expected Results
As in the rest of the editor, the link should be converted to a Jira macro

h3. Actual Results
The link is not converted to a Jira macro, as the example below:

!jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
(If there is no workaround directly say so)
fields.summary: Pasted Jira links are not converted to macro in tasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When adding an @user to an H1, the box is not big enough to surround the name, and this looks bad or makes it unreadable based on the situation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the format for mentions when using h1

h3. Why this is important
The formatting style should have a consistent pattern.
fields.summary: H1 header format spreads the text outside of box when mentioning users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence Cloud, when adding a link using the [Link Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/links-776656293.html], the user's *Recently Viewed* pages are not displaying. If any pages do display, it's generally the home page of a recently viewed space, but not the pages themselves.

The pages will appear in *Your work > Recently visited*

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Visit a few pages in Confluence and keep note of which pages you visited.
* On a new page, insert the link macro.

You'll see the recently viewed pages are
# Not in the list of suggestions
# If you click Search and go to *Recently Viewed* you will also not see them there.

h3. Expected Results
I would expect the pages either to be on the list of suggestions or under my Recently Viewed links.

h3. Actual Results
No pages are listed or only the homepage of a recently viewed space.
 
h3.Workaround
Insert the link manually
fields.summary: Link macro does not display recently viewed pages

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
If I want to view a page and click on Edit, the options are to publish, publish without notifying watchers, revert changes to last published page.  

Those options are available even if the user hasn't changed anything which may cause confusion.
fields.summary: UX is confusing when users don't make changes to pages in Edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After pasting a full URL of a Confluence space (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/space_name/overview) in a Slack channel, the space preview isn't shown. 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Connect a Slack channel to a Confluence Space 
# Configure the integration
# Copy a Confluence space URL (the space needs to be *unrestricted*)
# Paste the URL in the Slack channel

h3. Expected behavior
For unrestricted spaces, the preview should be shown. 

h3. Current behavior
For some spaces it shows the preview, but for others it doesn't, as shown in the image below:

 !spaces_slack.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When pasting a link from a Confluence space in Slack, it doesn't display the preview

fields.description:
As per the announcement:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html]

The multimedia macro is slated for deprecation.

I've only just recently started using this and find that the drag & drop functionality is nowhere near as good.

D&D preview doesn't work whereas the multimedia macro plays videos in page seamlessly.

This means that my users need to download video files to be able to play them when using D&D versus Multimedia macro which adds to network traffic and bandwidth.

Are there plans to improve the D&D functionality so that preview works a) quickly and b) is seamless?
fields.summary: Multimedia Macro - Deprecation - alternative not fit for purpose
Freeze HOT-84998

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence Admins who have created Global Page Templates would like a way to disable some of these User Created Templates on a Per Space basis as they may not be applicable in certain conditions

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option that will allow a Space Admin the ability to disable Global User Created Templates within their Individual Spaces

h3. Why this is important
Admins can disable System Blueprints Globally or per Space however Global User Created Templates do not have this functionality.
Admins would like to hide Templates that are not applicable in certain Spaces
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Include the Ability to Disable User Created Global Page Templates

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With the [introduction of the editing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], Confluence no longer converts a pasted hyperlink/page URL to the page title in the editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy a page URL from the browser.
# Create a new page using the new editor (e.g. a blog post or the *Meeting Notes* template)
# While editing this page, make sure to paste the URL copied before

h3. Expected Results
The URL should be converted to the page title, including the link to be clicked and redirected.

h3. Actual Results
The link keeps the URL format and is not converted:
!conversion.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Manually link the page using the *Link* function from the editor.
fields.summary: Pasting Hyperlink with Page URL Does not Convert to Title

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Left aligned picture break formatting of macro rendered on a page

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Insert some text on top of the page in a page layout
  # Create an image on a page and use the left-aligned on the image
 # Drag and drop the image on left side of the text
 # Create Info macro and Note macro on the bottom of the page and publish

** Edit Mode
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

** Preview Mode
**  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Expected Results*

The macro should be display on the bottom of the page

h3. *Actual Results*

The macros display on the attachment


h3. *Workaround*
Remove the left align on the image
fields.summary: Left aligned picture break the formatting of macro on a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating a new template using the *Meeting Notes* template, the same will come with instructional text while editing the page, as a guide for the user. The same is removed once the user puts text there, but, depending on where the same will put the text. 

For example, if the text is added *before* the instructional text, it will clear the same. However, if the text is added to the *end of the instructional text*, it will still be displayed in the edit mode, which can confuse some users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, click on the '+' icon and select the *Meeting Notes* template for the page creation
# Once the editor for the template is open, insert text *after* the instructional one (e.g. In the 'mentions' section or the *Decisions* one)

h3. Expected Results
The added text should clear the instructional one.

h3. Actual Results
The instructional text will still be displayed. 

h3. Notes
* The instructional texts also have some difficulty to be selected by hovering the cursor on it. By using the keyboard to select the content (Cmd/CRTL+ Shift), there is no problem.
* Attached a video with the experience. 

h3.Workaround
* Manually remove the section.
* Be sure to always add the text *in front* of the instruction.
fields.summary: Instructional Text Inconsistency in Meeting Notes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a 'What has changed comment' while editing a page and the comment contains a special character (e.g. +, -, _) this comment is shown correctly in Page History. However, in All Updates dashboard, the special characters are lost. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page
# add a comment in 'What has changed?' field "Test by Atlassian+"
# Save the changes
# Check Page History "Comment" will show "Test by Atlassian+"
# Check "All Updates" dashboard, the comment will show "Test by Atlassian" without "+"

h3. Expected Results
* All updates dashboard should show the exact comment added in 'What has changed' field

h3. Actual Results
* Special characters are not included in All updates dashboard
fields.summary: What has changed comment while editing is not updated properly in All Updates dashboard

fields.description:
I like the tree view in Confluence but can only get it on spaces I own. Please make it available on all spaces.

I find it very annoying to have to click on a parent page just to see the child pages; it forces a lot of unnecessary page loading if you need to go 4 levels deep to get to the desired page.  Additionally, once you are on a child page you can no-longer see pages on the same or higher level.  Again, this is very inconvenient.
fields.summary: I like the tree view in Confluence but can only get it on spaces I own.  Please make it available on all spaces.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an image is uploaded to a page using the Confluence Mobile App for Cloud on iOS, the preview of the image cannot be loaded when in the Confluence Web App on PC.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or enter a test page using the Confluence mobile app on iOS.
# Insert an image using the image icon at the bottom of the mobile page editor.
# Publish the page.
# The image displays OK on the iOS phone app.
# However, if a user browses to the page on the web browser on a PC, clicking on the image does not load the image with a MediaApi error

h3. Error information
Ouch! We can't load the image displayed
https://api.media.atlassian.com/etc

h3. Further tracing
Browser console returns an HTTP 404 error:
{code}
HEAD https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/9aa379a2-6e29-4475-8210-f32982ded96e/artifact/document.pdf/binary?client=b4c7bdd4-c7f1-4c1e-ad33-8b8549103a0c&token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJiNGM3YmRkNC1jN2YxLTRjMWUtYWQzMy04Yjg1NDkxMDNhMGMiLCJhY2Nlc3MiOnsidXJuOmZpbGVzdG9yZTpmaWxlOjlhYTM3OWEyLTZlMjktNDQ3NS04MjEwLWYzMjk4MmRlZDk2ZSI6WyJyZWFkIl19LCJleHAiOjE1Mzg2NTE2MjAsIm5iZiI6MTUzODY0ODI2MH0.pZNku7cQ3G36HtPGQXq_k78j3IPHwKq1SleYmklP_KE 404 (Not Found)
binary:1 


GET https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/9aa379a2-6e29-4475-8210-f32982ded96e/artifact/document.pdf/binary?client=b4c7bdd4-c7f1-4c1e-ad33-8b8549103a0c&token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJiNGM3YmRkNC1jN2YxLTRjMWUtYWQzMy04Yjg1NDkxMDNhMGMiLCJhY2Nlc3MiOnsidXJuOmZpbGVzdG9yZTpmaWxlOjlhYTM3OWEyLTZlMjktNDQ3NS04MjEwLWYzMjk4MmRlZDk2ZSI6WyJyZWFkIl19LCJleHAiOjE1Mzg2NTE2MjAsIm5iZiI6MTUzODY0ODI2MH0.pZNku7cQ3G36HtPGQXq_k78j3IPHwKq1SleYmklP_KE 404 (Not Found)
{code} 

h3. Workaround
On iOS, users can opt to upload the images using the iOS Safari Mobile web browser instead.
fields.summary: Images uploaded through Confluence Cloud Mobile App on iOS does not load in the Web Version of Confluence on PC

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It would be very convenient to have a "copy all" button on the widget which would automatically copy all of the text from the panel widget onto the clipboard.

h3. Suggested Solution
Should have "copy all" button

h3. Why this is important
Some of the scripts are pretty lengthy (like 100s-1000s of lines).

Therefore, we would love to see a 'copy to clipboard' button within the macro (maybe optionally with a parameter) so the admin has the option to copy all the content of the macro to the clipboard in one go and continue to his database administration studio or whatever, instead of scrolling down 1000 lines to copy everything.
fields.summary: Add button to copy content to clipboard from Panel Macro

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Occasionally the code block macro doesn't format appropriately for the selected syntax.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
  # Create a code block and select SQL for syntax highligting
 # Insert SQL as follow
{code}

select Testing1,Testing2,Testing3 from Testing321 union  all
select 
case when Testing like '%\_easy\_%';  escape '\' then 'Correct' else 'Wrong' end
from Testing123 where Test like '%WRONG%'
{code}

Noticed that the 'union all'  doesn't recognized as a keyword and the escape '\' causing the line below to be recognize as a keyword.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Expected Results*

'union all' should be recognized as a keyword and the escape '\' should not causing the where clause to be recognized as keyword.

h3. *Actual Results*

The formatting is wrong on the code block macro


h3. *Workaround*
None
fields.summary: Wrong formatting in code block macro

fields.description:
h2. Summary
While managing watchers if the username is long, it overflows from the dropdown box.
 !Screenshot_300.png|thumbnail! 

h2. How to reproduce
# Navigate to a page
# Manage watchers for the page
# Type a long username in the add watchers list

h3. Expected behavior
Long usernames are truncated.

h3. Actual results
Long usernames spill over the edge of the dropdown.

h2. Workaround
Currently none
fields.summary: Long usernames overflow when managing watchers

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Removing bullet list copied from Google docs re-arrange the bullet list in random order. 

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
  # Create a docs in Google Docs with the following example using Tab to indent the bullet list.
 **  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 # Copied and Paste it on Confluence Editor
 # Delete the bullet list according to the Test video from below:
 ** [^Bullet list.mp4]
 # Create a bullet list in Confluence manually would not able to replicate the same

h3. *Expected Results*

The bullet list should not be reordered and maintain on the same position

h3. *Actual Results*

The bullet list reorder in random order


h3. *Workaround*
Re-create the list manually from Confluence.
fields.summary: Removing bullet list copied from Google Docs re-arrange in random order
Can not attach an image with name "welcome.[jpg/png]"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pasting specific contents on new pages created with the new editor (blog posts/ meeting notes) can cause a Unsupported content error.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Blog post
# Copy some content from external sources i.e. Google Spreadsheets and insert into the page;
# Publish it.

h3. Expected Results
The blog post/page should render correctly.

h3. Actual Results
A "Unsupported content" box is shown instead of the page's content as shown below:  
!google_sheet_blog.gif|width=800! 

h3.Workaround
Remove the content from external sources.
fields.summary: Unsupported content with the new editor

fields.description:
h3. The Suggestion
Currently, it is only possible to save favorite Spaces on the landing page Sidebar, it would be very nice to have a way to add pages to the sidebar as well.
fields.summary: Allow users to save Pages in the Landing Page Sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a page tree is moved to another space, some of the links between pages are broken
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some pages. I.e. following the page tree below:
{code:java}
Parent page
├─ Child page 1
├─ Child page 2
│  └─ Child page 3
└─ Child page 4{code}

 # Copy the links to all 4 child pages and insert them into the Parent page;
 # Move the parent page to a different space

h3. Expected Results

The links should change to point to their new location
h3. Actual Results

In my first test, 2 of 3 links were broken,

in a second test, all of the links were broken:
|!Screen Shot 2018-10-03 at 15.13.57.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Notes

The broken links were changed from 
 [https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TS/pages/5505026/Child+page+1|https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TS/pages/5505026/Child+page+1] 
 to 
 [https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=TS&title=Child+page+1|https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=TS&title=Child+page+1]
h3. Workaround

*first Workaround*
 * Edit the copied page and correct the links.

*Second Workaround*
 # Create a copy of the page in the *SAME* space
 # Use the in-page operation (*** ->  Move)to "Move" the page to the desired Space
fields.summary: Moving pages between spaces breaks links

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira Service Desk users without Confluence access are getting access to the application and to all spaces.  

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Grant _jira_ access to users and remove access to Confluence
# Request the user to access the linked KBs in Confluence 
# Open a space and click on *All spaces*
# As an admin, open the user's account in the user management panel

h3. Current behavior
The application access to Confluence is checked for the user. 

h3. Expected behavior
The application access to Confluence shouldn't be checked if the access wasn't manually applied by the administrator. 

h3. Additional notes
(i) When navigating directly to the Confluence space using the full URL of the space (https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/XXX) allows access to all spaces and mark the checkbox access for Confluence to the user's account.
fields.summary: Users unauthorized to access Confluence are able to access the application

fields.description:
Presently, there is no "fall-back" available when deleted entire spaces - i.e. once you remove a space it is deleted permanently.

This feature which was closed as a timeout is still requested by our customers:
CONFCLOUD-8061

It would be helpful to have the "trash" feature like with deleting individual pages, so that Spaces which are removed can be restored with ease.

Suggested the following procedure:

1. Once a space is deleted, change the flag in the database table for that Space to "deleted"
2. Keep the Space in the table, but inactive.
3. Only delete the space permanently if the user "Purges" the trash.
4. Change the flag from "deleted" back to normal status, should the space be restored.
5. Log the activity of deletion; i.e. Log the timestamp for when the space was deleted, and by whom. 
6. Create a log file to log all this activity.
fields.summary: Rollback/Recovery option for Deleted Spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Many users cannot see the image below "Welcome to Confluence" under Activity tab

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Step 1 - Open your cloud instance. 
Step 2 - Click on Confluence and then Activity

h3. Expected Results
The image should be there below "Welcome to Confluence" message

h3. Actual Results
There is no image below the welcome message

h3.Workaround
NA
fields.summary: No Image is displayed below "Welcome to Confluence" message under Activity tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Confluence, when the users click on the option to [insert a link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/insert-links-and-anchors-724764900.html] or [move a page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/move-copy-and-hide-pages-724764858.html] and then, select *Recently Viewed*, the same will not bring any content. Instead, only the following message is displayed:

*_You have no recently viewed content_.*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create/edit a page in Confluence.
# While the editor is open, click on the *insert link* option from the editor menu. You can also try to click on the *page tools/ellipsis* button on the right side of the page and use the *Move* option
# Select the *Recently Viewed* option

h3. Expected Results
The linking dialog should bring a list of pages that were recently viewed by the user.

h3. Actual Results
Instead of bringing pages, the following message is displayed, in this case, using the link feature as an example:

!recently.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Recently Viewed does not retrieve pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While creating a page using meeting notes template, the customers are facing issues with indentation. It is outlined in the below documentation :

https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on "+" sign from Confluence sidebar
# Choose "Meeting Notes" and click Create

h3. Expected Results
Shouldn't be having an indentation

h3. Actual Results
Shows indentation issue

h3.Workaround
No Workaround
fields.summary: Meeting notes template has indentation issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we select a Status macro, we can see the border is not aligned with the macro.
!screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
* New Confluence Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page/blog post
# Add a table
# Within the table, add a Status macro
# Click on the status macro

h3. Expected Results
The border is aligned with the macro. Example:
!screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The border is slightly upper than the macro.
!screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
This only happens when inserting the status macro in a table
fields.summary: The Focus State of the Status Macro Is Not Aligned

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we insert a status macro, the color in *Edit ‘Status’ Macro* screen is different as shown after we saved the configuration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In new Confluence Editor, insert a status macro
# Set the color to grey
# Refresh the preview
# Save

h3. Expected Results
It should show Grey in color

h3. Actual Results
It shows dark blue instead of grey.
!screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* This only happens in new Confluence Editor.
* Yellow is showing as Orange, Blue is showing as light blue
* Other colors (green and red) are working fine.
fields.summary: The color in Edit ‘Status’ Macro screen is different as shown after we saved the configuration

fields.description:
At the moment, when attaching an image to the page, there are no options for the users to highlight or point anything inside the same. Similar to image editors, there are different shapes (like circles and rectangles) to be added to an image to a specific part can be marked/highlighted. 

This is a suggestion to allow Confluence to include content inside an image for highlighting purposes.
fields.summary: Highlight Options in Images for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new editor (blog/ meeting notes/ templates), the macro selector is not reliable, not inserting the macro or inserting a different one.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * New editor update

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new blog post or meeting notes (or any other page from template that is using the new editor);
 # Type "/" to enter the macro selector;
 # Type "activity" or "work"

h3. Expected Results

The macro selector should insert the correct macro.
h3. Actual Results

It doesn't insert the macro or insert a different one, as shown below:
 !new_editor_macros.gif|width=750!
h3.  Notes

A similar behavior occurs when using the *+* (insert) -> *•••* See more -> *Select macro* method.
h3. Workaround

No known workaround so far.
fields.summary: New editor's macro selection is not reliable

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As per [People directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/people-directory-939512608.html] the current search behavior for the people directory is:
{quote}
When you view the people directory, you see a blend of two sets of users:
* Other users on the site whose email domain matches yours. This excludes known public email domains such as @gmail.com.
* Other users who have edited the same content as you in the last 90 days.
{quote}

This becomes a problem for bigger companies that have users from multiple domains that not always edit the same content in the instance.

h3. Suggested Solution

Change the search behavior so it only relies on the profile visibility setting and not product activity/domain.
fields.summary: Enhance people directory search

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Importing a Jira backup in to an existing Cloud instance with Confluence will cause all Confluence spaces/pages that were watched previously to no longer be watched after the restore is completed

h3. Environment
 
* Atlassian Cloud instance with both Jira and Confluence active

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Cloud insance with both Jira and Confluence active, watch a page or space in Confluence
# Import a Jira site backup

h3. Expected Results

Jira data is imported and Confluence pages that were watched previously continue to be watched by the same user accounts

h3. Actual Results

Confluence pages that were being watched before the import are no longer watched after the import is completed.

h3.Workaround

Manually re-add user accounts as watchers
fields.summary: Watchers in Confluence are wiped after Jira import

fields.description:
It would be fantastic if we could search for words selecting the space.

In my team, we use Confluence a lot, but we usually lose track of what we include. We wish, we could select a space and type a word to find the pages or texts that include that word.

Thanks
fields.summary: Improve Search functionality
Confluence REST API does not create "rich content" for children display macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence settings > Space permissions page lists all the individual spaces with Name, Key and Operations columns.

If the Confluence admins do not have access to a space, they can only "recover permissions" to access the space to see the the owner of the space, admins etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow option to include more columns - e..g., Created by, Administrators etc so that the admins don't have to recover permissions. 


h3. Why this is important
helps get a better overview on all the spaces and who controls them.
fields.summary: Allow Admins to select additional columns to display in Global Space Permissions page
